page.title: 14The Church in Wales
page.content: St. Michael's Parish Church is a building of historic interest, originally called St. Elbod after the Bishop of Bangor who in 755 A.D. gave land on the bank of the river Gele to the Church. The present Norman structure dates from the 13th century when it was rededicated to St.Michael. The old vicarage near the Church has been sold his year and has become an old people's home. The new vicarage is situated at the other end of town in Rhuddlan Road. The present Vicar is Rev. D. J. Roberts B.Sc. He has a wife Bethan and 3 children. It is a bilingual Church and has 2 choirs, a Welsh choir with 12 members and an English choir with 20 members. About 20 children attend the Sunday School. There is an English morning service at 11.00 am and a Welsh Service at 6.30 pm.
